item.title: Reborn
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
So I've been doing great and after this will be speaking a lot more about what I have been doing but I've been doing a lot of thinking and figuring myself out atm. At night due to multiple naps in the day I've found my brain becoming overactive many hours into the morning. As I lay in bed, my mind starts to wander and begin to think ill disciplined thoughts. Just thoughts of things that I'm doing or have done earlier, analyzing them from several different angles. I can feel my mind trying to figure itself out. You may remember I spoke before of my experiencing self feeling nervous at times, I was laying in bed and my mind was running through thoughts about how to explain myself, to you but really for me. As I began to attempt to write out a thought process for you I stopped, I couldn't think of one, my Brain went cloudy and couldn't explain it. This is because that side of me, in the moment, the loose thoughts I struggle to control, care what people think of me. Would care what people thought of this. But the other side of me is not so bothered, obviously it's nice to be liked but he knows it matter most what I think of me and at the moment, that's positive. But I still have my moments, surprisingly less in new social situations, I seem to do ok in them. Its weirdly more a little bit later when I guess people are getting to know me better and it can head down into a spiral that may go a little bit like this:
  1. I wonder if they like me
  2. Do they think im fun
  3. Oh im not talking and its gone quiet, shit
  4. I dont know what to say
  5. ermmm, (chats shit or does something stupid and weird)
  6. Why did you say/do that you idiot
  7. You're an idiot
  8. Why do you think so much about yourself
  9. You're a self-centered idiot
  10. Shut up
  11. Oh its silent again
  12. Better do something to stop this
At the moment my head is very understanding, its annoying but I also know its just my head doing this to me when I'm overwhelmed, its just tries to bring it back to clear and start again. I'm now doing well to think of it as waves on the beach, if I try and fight these thoughts and suppress it, it is futile and only gets worse, I get hotter and cloudier in the head. But if I just see these thoughts coming as a tide for example I imagine myself stepping back on the beach and just watching them come and pass. and surprisingly they fade out quicker than expected. They still occur but it's definitely getting better. My experiencing self, I feel like I wanna give them names but I also feel that's a slippery slope lol, but my experiencing self is quite weak or feels emotions strongly, which sometimes I love because I get extremely happy and excited, cry alot at movies and feel alot of love for friends, family and girlfriends. But other times as explained it can get overwhelming in the negative sense, particularly nerves. When I was a lot younger I used to be an anxious child, with my nickname being worried Arthur, a story my parents used to read to me about a penguin who always worried over silly things. Now in the story, everything always worked out fine and actually it really helped me because somewhere I realised it did. So I guess thats why I never verbalised my thoughts, only on occasions when I was really worried and even then only to close friends. That attitude ofÂ  has stuck to an extent but therein lies the fracture of my being, the worry matched with the "it'll all be fine" This is the mantra my narrating self has and hes usually right, actually my narrating self I feel very good about, I feel its quite wise and has good ideas, he makes me do things. In fact I think his biggest issue is an ego and when I'm happy for a while sometimes I need to contain that. So there is both sides of the coin. Now if you are reading this don't be worried because these are not new thoughts, in fact I felt these spirals stronger at home. I couldn't really discuss it and the fact I can even write this down is a good thing. Back home if it was happening it a lot I would question if I like myself.Â But I do and I know I do, although I would like to work on the self centered aspect of myself which is definitely not helped by this blog atm or the books I'm reading on my psyche! The fact I'm writing this down is also a sign I'm regaining control. I'm working on dealing with silence and working on chilling out my overwhelmed states. Actually this is clearing out my head and I believe that its helping with the peacefulness I'm starting to feel. This is the me I know and have seen in various stages and I can feel it coming back. I also feel clearer and actually am becoming less self centered, enjoying more and more things around me (I just needed to get this out). I will still have my moments but these will pass as do the tides. Kids See Ghosts - Reborn

item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
things i've learnt
  1. portuguese
you don't need to travel I'm having an absolute ball and it satisfies my curiosity immensely. people including the media show you something and we make our own minds up. it's natural. but then something in me wants to see it myself. this can sometimes be negative, for instance, America. Many things and people I loved there, but they have a bravado that shows the world they are amazing. A night in LA to me seemed the coolest and most fun place in the world. They stop serving alcohol at 1:45 in california. San Francisco included. And they don't go out earlier. They kill you in the good zone. Not saying they dont have events. There are a million places to go, but you gotta get a lil summit summit else. No wonder they have so many crackheads in LA. Vegas was the same. Not for time, but the same bravado. The craziest place on earth. Lol. Because people nearby cant drink till 6 and arent allowed to gamble. I can do that scunthorpe on a weekend. (disclaimer) I'm not advocating scunthorpe over vegas. Scunthorpe is just as shit. But Bournemouth over Vegas anyday. Unless you got money I guess. But that makes it way more exclusive/douchey. I might always combine those words. But for real I'm having the best time and would recommend to anyone who asks if they should. Because if they ask that, they are curious themselves and it would only be a positive experience. Beyond what they could imagine. But on the flip side. I have met as many great people who don't give a flying fuck or at least aren't bothered. I miss a group back home in truth. My brothers friends. My brother, who will read this, who has the house and the wife and the dog. The complete opposite to the path I've taken. He is probably more happy than I am. Shows that there is no blueprint and actually in parallel to some of the fantastic moments I've had here, I've had in Wolston, whether in the local pub or in gardens nearby at a barbecue, all emotions we have which make us feel positive or negative occur in the body. Not in a place. That being said I wouldn't trade it for anything and I could use the same argument to help travelling. You can feel it anywhere and you will and it will open your mind as cliche as it sounds. Maybe it's brazil, maybe it's the acceptance of emotions, maybe it's my drunk mind but the feeling of interactions the world over, with those in other countries that are the same really gives a beautiful connectivity feeling. I'm not talking energies, but the ideas we are all just the same, like a huge ant colony that tbf has got out of control. IÂ  don't nave anxiety, but boy can I get anxious in social situations. It's a passing feeling in truth. The primary feeling that occurs before I either ignore it, tell it to shut up, or listen. It occurs mainly in social situations in truth but it's better when I don't listen to it. In truth I have many of these primary feelings or thoughts that are just wrong. Fear. Actually I gotta be honest, this one I lack more than is probably healthy but I remember one old guy in cornwall once told me that "people spend most their lives worrying about things that will probably never happen" and I always partnered this with the baz luhrmann song that says "worrying is like chewing gum..... finish quote..." and this is true. So while this of course brings with it a certain naivety, it also allows great things to happen. Don't get me wrong. I am not free from worry, I do not ignore advice, but actually when you think about it and give it a chance, things usually turn out alright. I've been in what people would call precarious situations but actually things have always turned out alright. In terms of South America, I have heard a lot of tales of danger as had my parents. Now of course. I am not denying that it occurs and all the dangers that occur. In fact I have met several people who have been robbed. Some at gunpoint. But they have all come out okay and actually they seem less fearful and have come out absolutely ok. I want to reiterate that it does happen and that I am sure it is a harrowing experience and I do not want it, but the percentage of those who it happens to who travel is ............research........... which is the same as (another sta in england that's safe). So bad things happen and of course I'm generally sheltered but I'd rather live free from worry of things happening and deal with them when (if) they do. Yes people will say that I'm sheltered and of course I'm not heading into ridiculous areas but I hear people saying to not go to places or to not get my phone out on the subway or in copacabana. I can tell you everyone has their phone out on the metro, just like in london and I always go on my phone if i so desire in copacabana and the onyl time it was robbed was in lapa when i had shit pockets and it was in my pockjets. everywhere I go,Â  people are just getting on with their lives. Ignoring me. In fact sometimes I do get an urge to hold on to my phone or keep it in my pocket if I see someone who looks poorer, is close or is from a favela. but guess what. that's my own prejudice. And also one of those thoughts that first comes to mind. If I really believed it I would be a very closed and judgemental person. Now of course on the flipside. I feel it. I'm not denying that that thought occurs. It occurs. But I don't believe it. I have it occasionally and I think, wow thats not a great thought. It's the same with race. ocassionally I will have a thought that is inherently racist, more judgemental but in the end racist. I always catch myself and think wow, that's wrong. But to echo or stand on the shoulder of John Barnes, to deny it is to make it worse. To deny or even condemn that thought is not going to make it better. In the same vein as ignoring a pain. Actually it makes things worse. I really believe in the two pieces of media I have seen that he has spoke on, he has a very wise opinion. On both racism in football and racism with the whole Liam Neeson argument. The feeling occurs. The thought it occurs. It's not a wrong feeling, because how can there be, it occurs. Clearly, shown by those who follow through with it. But also those who don't talk about it, those who hide it, because they are in fear of being lambasted. But I truly believe this has been part of the rise of the right wing. People feel it. They don't say it out loud because it is a damaging thought and they are told they are terrible people. Guess what they are not. They are people. As John Barnes elequently puts. You can not blame him for thinking this way because this is what society portrays. This is what the media shows. This is the general consensus. This is now the general person I am talking about. Now I have never gone as far as Liam Neeson to want to kill a man but of course his experience was multiplied due to circumstances. But it is the same on a lesser level. The racism still occurs. Unconciously. Take the man who says that we are all a little racist when we are hungry. Maybe not when I'm hungry but essentially the most animalistic feelings bring up these thoughts. Many say its evolutionary. A reaction to tribal instincts, maybe there is some truth to that. In fact alot of truth but of course we are not as animalistic as our once protective ancestors and we have a higher level of consciousness that when activated understands the ridiculous of this emotion and that it is completely driven by fear. To act on this emotion is damaging. To feel it though, is human. We are still animals at the end of this day. This occurs. Many animalistic thoughts. To deny it is to ignore it and to ignore it is just as damaging. To believe it though is racist. Many thoughts that occur in our heads are not to be believed and with free thought, which is more prominent nowadays, leads to both more negative and positive thoughts. more solutions, more points of views, new ideas, darker places. Thoughts of suicide are also frequent thoughts, even sometimes at a happy point of my life. Other negative thoughts. To fight them doesnt work................... To allow them to pass and see them as the negative thoughts they are alleviates them. To discuss them alleviates them even more. To believe them could have lead to a terrible view of the world, of other people, friends and strangers alike and dyer consequences to myself and also leads to the continuation of racial equality. Because of the way we have been brought up. But also the freedom of thought in many has always brought us to new ways of thinking and thanks to the mass sharing of information many things have occurred. It has provided those who listen and think to become woke. To see what is going on. I am not woke. I am listening to everything and to be honest that is just confusing. There is many contradictions and trust me, you cannot listen to everyine and take everyones word. It doesn't add up. There are also the sharing of those first feeling emotions and thoughts. It is these that I believe have caused problems. The views of those of the racists and the fascists who believe many of the tabloid headlines, reading the headlines or see another opinion and it validates their own fear or their own prejudices. With validation comes solidifying. al murray quote But that doesn't happen anymore. It happens on social media where people can choose where to lean/who to be friends with i.e similar people. I have one friend who put a status about everyine deleting him if they vote for tory. I have only written this in because he's probably the only person I'll ever show this to. But essentially and while I'm not dissing you harry but this is a good example of what naturally occurs on social media, although not as extravagant. My algorithm shows me many naturey based things because I like them. polarizing. In the same way though I feel memes or many things I read pay particular attention to that first feeling we feel in a number of hilarious scenarios. And while most of these are absolutely spot on, they validate and strengthen my feelings. Oh wait, you feel anxious when you first meet someone, or are delighted when someone cancels. me too! amazing. That's a human feeling. That's ok then, I will continue to feel that. But this is where it comes to a divide. Both sides are negative. We believe our feelings. Why wouldn't we. We finally have a platform to put them out to the world as they happen and the whole world can validate them. Not just your own pocket of friends who can validate your racism or your anxiousness. maybe before there was a small group who validated your opinion, I say this on my own unchecked thoughts from my own experience of growing up in a racist village. where the local pub is a melting pot of validation for racism. At least it was. Now with the rise of the internet, the younger generation in the village (most of it) have been able to see other points of view and have listened to understand other people and with free thinking have become more open minded to others opinions but with that has come the overwhelming influx of others opinions which has only added to our own anxiousness and self doubt that we are not good enough or not great people. With seeing those views of other people or the great things they say, or the popular things they say. They can choose to say their immediate feelings or put their thought out thoughts out there. People will relate to both. Both a positive and a negative. It's nice to feel validated for the feelings we have, it's human. It's not good to just take our feelings as true without thinking about them. It's good to think about things before acting, but unfortunately I guess we think people feel these things and this is their unbelievable nature. This is where, for better or for worse, but in fact I think it's balanced, I have both. I understand the negative feelings of anxiousness as well as animalistic anger and hatred and immediate racism or prejudice. As well as it must be said, the immediate bond, the love for a stranger or occurence. I also understand the need to think about what we say, now more than ever. This is why I will have edited this a few times. I have been known to do things without thinking and also overthink. it's not easy. That first feeling of hate is completely misguided, damaging and inhibits better feelings. But I feel it. That first feeling of anxiousness is completely misguided, damaging and inhibits better feelings. But I feel it. Denying the feelings we have is also damaging. To condemn it is to stop the conversation and a brighter future in understanding how we can deal with it. From an unconsciously racist, overthinking snowflake, who welcomes everyone with open arms and loves everyone he meets and every situation he finds himself in.

item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
Hmmm

Been a tough week in truth. Nothing has really happened to have caused this tough week. But a few purchases for the future has left me using the savings as a float. Sure the money will come back in but I've got to make sure that I don't see my current balance as my new 0 which always happens when using a float. It also my next paycheck is half spent, leaving me with only living money. Again. Life I suppose.

And plans for the future of moving around are looking cloudy to say the least. And I'm feeling very split with the guilt of flying around mixed with the want of seeing countries.

In my head it's perfect, travel around South America, in a clockwise direction, stopping by every country on the way on the west side until I meet Venezuela. Seeing as many ruins as I can as I then attempt the crossing through Central America, particular focus on Guatemala and Mexico before popping over for a week in Cuba, just because and trying to finish in America to catch a basketball game, before making the trip home.

God it all sounds so perfect. In a world where money ain't a thang, or I have a sugar mama companion or even in a world that isn't fucked up by well, flying around. Even thinking about the trip gets me excited, the new countries, the new people, the shenanigans, the ruins, the look of my been app. The whole experience.

But in truth on Monday we got talking about environmental issues and the population of the planet amongst other things and it left me feeling pretty sad about the whole thing if I'm honest. The population will grow by 30% in 30 years and with the state of our CO2 emissions not slowing down at a quick enough rate we appear to be driving off a cliff.

And sure, I'm one man, those flights are probably gunna go anyway and it's my right to do whatever the fuck I want. I'm not flying every other day across the globe, I haven't left Rio in 8 months and only use buses with the occasional uber. But still it's the continuing attitude that all adds up. I'm not saying nobody should fly anymore, but if we all think that I'm only one person it doesn't matter it will just continue at it's current rate.

If we all cut back then maybe the flight companies might decide to invest quickly in the solar panel flights which have occured [link] to make flight more sustainable.

Maybe then I could do my trip guilt free in a greener South America in the future, maybe as a retiree or with a wife. Or maybe it's better to wait for a computer simulation that appears so real it won't even matter like in San Junipero [black mirror]. God that would be great.

So I've been battling with myself and to be honest at the moment, I still feel like I'll do it but I'll just feel guilty about it.

Which is obviously stupid but after watching peep show again recently I feel validated in all these thoughts and battles.

Fairplay to extinction this week who appear to have been causing a ruckus in London this week. This kind of disruption is exactly whats needed, to point out that carrying on the why we are isn't working. There needs to be a bigger change. If i was home I would like to think I would have joined in but again I probably wouldn't have.

It's these inner battles between what I should do and what I want to do that cause cognitive dissonance and many of us know how I don't like to be told what I should do. As do many of us, the two sides, the ego and the id. We all want to do what makes us feel good and do things that our society has created to enjoy ourselves. Great it feels good, but the other side of what we should do to be a good citizen, global or local and right now it appears to be act green.

Now of course if we are told to do this and it goes against our urges, which it does because of how society is already set up, doomed to plunge off the cliff it feels uncomfortable. So I don't feel wrong for wanting to do these things or a bad person, but I do feel guilty, hating my own brain for being in the back telling me should you do that. Fuck off brain let me be ignorant.

I've asked this question for years, would I rather be ignorant and happy or seek the truth and battle with it.

The answer is the truth, although sometimes i hate it. But as ricky gervais put well after his rollercoaster of a series afterlife, It feels better to the do the right thing. In the long run.

This month has been definitely dominated by the ego and trying to do things good for me, doing nice things for me in the future. Getting work done early so I don't have to do it later, getting things redy so that when I do feel drained or annoyed I dont then have to work or clean before doing what I want to do.

And I've worked fantastically even if I do say so myself, but, Butttt this week has been a real downer.

In truth, here I've isolated myself a bit. I'm working at home morning and night and only hang out at home, because it's cheaper to stay in and I only do stuff on the weekend. Which has been genuinely fine, and great now the playoffs is on but my recent plans to go away for the weekend have been scuppered by cost, mixed in with the constant isolation and recent environmental thoughts/flying guilt it's all combined and rolling in circles causing a negative spiral with one leg contradicting another.

I'm feeling a little alone and repetitive => I should go away for the weekend => I don't have the money really => need to work => not doing that much => will go travelling over the summer => planes & money => need a job and feel a little isolated => maybe I could get a job in an office => need to learn more

It all just rolls around, with a bit of self loathing in there about my abilities, tthe fact my 'weak' brain is cycling in these thoughts and because clearly some of things are my decisions, that in truth I still want to do. If anything I don't actually feel isolated most the time, just been an overwhelming week that started off this spiral. I actually enjoy the learning and the basketball.

In truth it may have come from a lack of sleep on the Monday dues to basketball but I've definitely caught up and it is still present, just about. But I'm talking about it. I just really need to think and clearly about what the next step is, I don't think this is all achievable. Essentially the learning will take time and I want to have learnt it, have we not created a device like the matrix where we just upload it. Jokes. that would be a nightmare. Imagine how much the elit would know compared to the proletariats. It would widen the gap massively, but it would be cool to know Japanese without actually learning it.

No it wouldn't. the learning is the best part of it. Jesus can you see the state of my mind. Peep show has been an absolute saviour, their inner monologues are so relatable and honest that I find myself laughing aloud on my bed due to similar thoughts. Just showing the negative and stupid thoughts we have as normal. It's great.

But all I need is patience. I have my plan, I may need to be a bit more realistic about future plans of enjoyment but I'm on the right path. I actually feel ready to come back if so be the case and begin my life working as a functioning member of society.

item.title: Follow the Sun
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
I'm a thinker, for better or worse and I wouldn't change it despite the that occasional overthinking vortex that I can be drawn into.

It tends to revolve around happiness. My happiness, other people's happiness, what causes it and takes it away, the pursuit and the feeling. It's not really the essence of life but it is the best thing, the positive feelings. From a logical point of view it's doing things that cause the chemicals to flow around the body that give us a good feeling. How do I keep this flowing? Love? Purpose? Enjoyment? Family? Beer? The Sun?

I believe the last one is such a huge factor that it plays the biggest role throughout all of history.

Back in England with most of us whom I discuss such a subject we perceive the latins as having a better way of life, enjoying it more despite their apparent lack of technology and functioning parts in comparison to the more developed countries.

As I sit in a coffee shop in autumn in 30 degrees completely happy yet looking around I see the exact same type of people. The two on their phones awaiting their food. The couple having a chinwag with no real emotion and the group of couples louder sharing their beers and good times. A sight not out of place at the Malt on a busy evening. But it's outside. All year round.

I do have a very small sample size but Rio, seen as a beacon of happiness despite their problems, is as stereotypical as it seems. The work rate might not be the highest but they do seem to be happy and I think it's only the sun and there no need to really exert energy because they are just happy with how it is, life by the beach.

It's hard to argue, though that there is a better place than England in the sun. Not having it all the time makes us appreciate it more. and as discussed with all brits abroad, we miss the beer garden despite the fact I've been drinking outside all year round. there's something about it.

It's also fair to say that we can become pretty miserable when the weather is grim for a long period of time. There's not many worse places than Coventry on a cold grey afternoon. I know Messi can't handle it in stoke.

And as we go north and the weather becomes colder and becomes to a point that even the sun disappears for a prolonged period of time. It is here that they have the highest suicide rates. It is common knowledge that these are linked.

But then the nordic countries also score so highly on the happiness index, so how does that work.

Now of course these thoughts are just from my own meandering exeperience and don't hold the broadest of sample sizes and are a product of my own thoughts and info I've consumed. But from two trips up to scandinavia and the basis of all the scandfinavians I have encountered at mainly university, they seem to be so fucking perfect. Annoyingly so. They are all tall, beautiful and nice people who have exactly the right thoughts and attitude to life. They keep themselves perfectly trimmed and the perfect tonedness. They clearly go the gym and work on their bodies but it always seems to be the perfect amount. It's sickening.

Essentially it comes down to their discipline, to think these things, have this work ethic and achieve their happiness. Even when I think back to Henrik, Onni and the other guy whose name I can't remember they are sculptures who were hard-working individuals.

Now of course this is my own stereotype I've built in my head, I'm sure there are swedes completely different to this. But so far I haven't met them and of course I won't hold anyone to that when I meet them.

On the flipside, the brazilians as I've previously noted seem more passionate, emotional and act upon their feelings. They seem a freer people which of course is not a bad thing. They appear at least in Rio with less of a work ethic and perceived discipline but compared to Scandinavian countries have a much lower suicide rate.

It appears and is known that of course the sun has a large effect on this, on our wellbeing at the end of the day and of you have it then you apparently need less discipline of the mind to keep being happy. Seasonal affectional disorder is a thing but we all at least know of the January Blues, without Christmas to look forward to back home then goddamn winter would be depressing and January is just the worst. Thank god that someone put christmas then. Could it be lucky that Jesus was born then?

Or is that deliberate.

Over a few table beers the other week I sat with a Northern Irishmen and a German discussing the old civilizations and religions and their worshipping of the sun. It was then we got round to discussing the documentary zeitgeist that made the rounds circa 2012 about the similarities between Christianity and the ancient religions.

I haven't gone into depth about the Incas but boy do I want to. That could well be the next place on the agenda. Many thoughts here spark interest in the civilizations of old. The Incas, The Mayans and the Aztecs. My journey could take me up through Central America to explore them.

It compares the story of Christ to the winter solstice, falling on the 22nd of December, which ends the previous cycle of the Sun, before its rebirth, after 3 days...

Funny enough during this time, the 3 stars of Orion's belt happen to line up with the brightest star in the sky, the north star.

With Jesus being the sun of God and old religions such as the Egyptians worshipping Ra the sun god, as well as older religions following a similar pattern, it starts to appear as if thye all follow the same pattern. The sun being the giver of life. Knowing how farming works along with the water the giver of food and of warmth. Religions have always known the sun gods to be givers of life only now science has proven that it indeed is, but it is one of many stars in a vast universe and it is sheer chance we are here.

And although the odds are literally astronomical. The universe is infinite and has been around for billions of years. So considering these statements, life is bound to have formed. Probably in more than one place. I wonder if other lifeforms worship their sun or suns or maybe their moons. Either way it's a logical thought pattern.

So as we know today it is (probably) not as powerful as the ancient gods seem and we hold less power to it. I maybe feel that it is underplayed in our behaviours as I have been to at different parts of the globe. As our heavenly father we still ask him for life and for happiness and you'll find people flocking to sandy churches to bask in his glory and I for one am a fan.

So as the days get a bit colder here although not cold, not even a little bit. I will move to explore more of this beautiful country although I will head North and follow the warmth of the Sun, the giver of life.

happiness â

the undiscipline of the latins - the percieved quality of life
â

the discipline of the nordics - the happiness alongside the suicide - needed
â

the sun and it's benefits
â

the zeitgeist

fasting and pork

religion

the sun worshippers

the north

following the sun

item.title: Trapped in my Mind
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
Time is drawing to a close, both on my time in Rio and the world nihillistically.

I am almost itching to move and start my next chapter. A lot has been spent here working on me amongst other skills. If you remember I referred to things happening one step at a time and it's amazing to see the difference, if you just keep on plodding on, doing the same thing over and over again, practicing. Things just become easier don't they.

I'm faffing around here to get to why I am really here typing. trying to find an in. Still am. Into my mind essentially and use my fingers to parse the thoughts out into words and sounds or characters joined together so you can make sense of them. Wow I'm still doing it.

It's mainly a self doubt thing as to why it's so difficult to throw it out. Every attempt matched by thoughts already criticising it before it comes out. I mean I've spent probably years of my life going over it in my head. Understanding and misunderstanding. Having it solved before a new piece of information I haven't thought of springs in and changes everything.

Just keep on going despite it. The fake it till you make it way. I was asked about it recently and although it is how I have always worked, particularly in jobs, I am actually not a big fan, I find a lot of situations end up with with not making it, at least in terms of my own head, which can only make it harder and harder.

This week with the end of Rio drawing near i've been very up and down, finding myself dancing around my room, cleaning and thinking positive thoughts about every aspect of life to lying in my bed in a low state of self loathing and complete lack of faith. The worst thing is it's largely unexplainable, I just find myself in these positions enjoying the highs and trying to ride out the lows.

I've recently had a change in diet adding in a lot of fruit and in turn a lot of sugar but of course it's surely more deep rooted than that. I've began to stabilise with less fruit and also beginning to meditate. Again. But I feel good about this time. That's felt good, building the habit, already feeling it becoming easier than 2 weeks ago, thanks to the headspace app.

I've also found myself despite these lows being much stronger at the bottom and not wallowing but actually stopping my thoughts and trying to turn it around, channel it or find myself relaxing.

With other things that I struggle to find the motivation to do, I find my brain automatically to telling me this is the time that I need to do them to train the brain. To work, to learn, to finish off the memos. Do it now so future Marco won't have to. Funny enough that usually gets the ball rolling with some energy and motivation, as crucifying as it may be.

I've always been poor with self-discipline but I feel it turning, I've always talked of freedom and wanting my mind to run free and there are may great things that come from that, ideas, thoughts, new experiences but as we explore our minds it leads us to some darker places , we go to further depths. It's almost a trade-off,

damn I'm struggling to word it but I promise you, it's so eloquent and perfect in my head. I think that's because when I'm putting it out onto here I already have the scrutiny of it. Of course this can be a great thing, critical thinking, to really scrutinize and think through everything. But that could be what keeps us in our mind so much. We are so damn critical of every thought at the moment. Damn I just typed quite a lot but immediately thought of a counter argument in the voice of someone else that made me rethink and put it back. I've now got to a standstill in my mind. the urge to shut the laptop and go to bed. I already know I won't post this. This is just for me at this point. But also the urge to not give nin. That is what I want to build on.

I do think sometimes I let my mind run rather free and that's what takes me to these dark places, but I also enjoy thinking down new ways of thinkings, what it could be because of, what is wrong with our minds at the moment. Sometimes I hate it cause it's always on and sometimes it takes me down to some dark places but I must say I like that reaching these areas of my mind I think helps me connect with people on all plains. I particularly am glad to be there for people and I feel I understand them when they are in their dark place. Of course there are people who have been to much darker places and higher places than I have, another criticism I feel to explain.

Sometimes it's just tiring and I want to live. I want to stop criticising the criticising I'm doing. God damn, I tried to let my thoughts run free on the page and it's not actually done me that much good. A lot of the time yes. I think it's on the blog. Even though I wont post it I want to, to show whats on my mind. But when I thought about it then I thought it's not even saying alot and not well written. Of course I will edit. Wow I'm really just going off now, think I need to stop these trains and just think back to headspace, let the thoughts just pass and notice them. Damn, I love that voice, I'm gunna go finish my kid cudi album and listen to some headspace sleep shizz.

I already feel less critical of my thoughts and in turn myself and then even more in turn of others, although actually i think im pretty good at that already. Lol trapped in my mind, just came on. That's the song for the post and the last one on the album. And one I've rapped over. IN my head I went to type poorly though, but that's just to self deprecate because i straight away criticised in my head. This actually has been therapeautic, again I think ive let it run free and actually found a good conclusion. go me.

item.title: We didn't start the fire
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
It's been two weeks since we left the Amazon. Little did we know it was burning whilst we were there. On first hearing about it, myself and Harry both had a brief moment hoping that we hadn't started it. We hadn't. But the more I heard the sadder I got.

This is exactly what was feared when Bolsonaro was rising. He was always going to tear down the Amazon for Brazil's interest. His "anti-indigenous rhetoric and the administrationâs lax enforcement policies have emboldened the illegal miners to be more aggressive and threatening." "Earlier this year, the governmentÂ cutÂ the budget of various agencies responsible for fire prevention". There is no doubt he is making things worse but deforestation has been rising in Brazil since 2012. It's so frustrating that Lula who seemed to lower deforestation and seemed to rise people out of poverty got involved with corruption. His legacy ruined and his people hurt were the prime conditions for 'anti-corruption' Bolsonaro to thrive.

Even though he is not completely to blame, the problem is that we are at a time which is more important than ever to protect the Amazon and he doesn't care. He never has and probably never will. He has always stuck by this and yet still he was voted in. We need to have leaders in place that will do as much to help slow climate change, not accelerate it.

He wants to use the land for economic gain and does all of this behind the ideals that it's what the Europeans did for hundreds of years, which is true, but not helpful now. It's the hypocrisy of the developed countries to advise those developing not to do something which in turn gave us our vast amounts of wealth and in fact kept the countries we stole from at a lower economical level. But we know better now. Or do we. He also uses this when being asked about the aid from Europe or from the threatened trade embargo's.

The real problem on top of this is that China is increasing it's influence in the region, loaning billions of dollars to Latin American countries in the form of energy and infrastructure projects. With high interest rates it allows China certain power over their indebted counterparts. Exactly what Europe and America used to do which gave them power down here.

Now the reason this is a problem is because "Chinese loans do not have governance and environmental conditions attached to them." Bolsonaro and his administration have been skeptical about taking aid from European countries believing it be an attempt to " undermine Brazil's sovereignty in the region." and that "There is a clear effort to extrapolate real environmental problems into a fabricated 'crisis', as a pretext to introduce external control mechanisms in the Amazon,â said Ernesto Araujo, Brazil's foreign minister.

Given the historical context, you can understand, but given the serious of the climate crisis facing the whole world it's important that Europe continues to still put pressure on and also work together to do the best we can for both humanity and the earth.

In the end it was us who started this, the Europeans, we wiped out civilizations (which was the way of the world back then), but we wiped out civilizations who lived off the land in a much more sustainable way than us. Took what they did not use and used the minerals to spark our industries which in turn have led to many of the great things that give us a comfortable life and allow me to be here or even more paradoxically know about what went on/is going on but all of this at the expense of the environment. Will it be worth it?

This ball is still rolling from hundreds of years ago and now we want to make a change. It's hard to slow down something with that much momentum and now that those countries are wanting to develop in these industries we want to slow it down. It's too late. Particularly as China is now one of the driving forces. Guess we have to try though ey?

I'm one to talk, I'm down here, doing nothing, I was in there on a jolly two weeks ago and if I hadn't already booked my flight to Mexico or had more money then I would have gone to Ecuador on workaway to do some reforestation. Or maybe I'm just telling myself that, I already knew that the Amazon was being fucked up, it's hardly a surprise. I want to save the environment as long as it's not at a cost to my convenience. There's billions of mes. This is why we're doomed.

To be honest if we love the environment as much as we say, we should continue, it will wipe us out, it will recover. We won't.

As for me I did spend too much on our tour around travelling and that has led me to work so that I can afford my crawl up to Mexico and then make it home.

I have now just booked my flight back home(ish) flying from Cuba to Brussels before megabussing it home. I'm not sure if I'll ever be back in Latin America so thought it best to pop into Cuba before I make the leg back to Europe. I've worked pretty solidly here in Peru for the last two weeks so I should be able to enjoy a bit of a holiday at the end. By working, I mean chatting and reading articles with Japanese people.

I don't mind not having that much money whilst travelling, I head to the market nearby and enjoy a two course lunch every day for the equivalent of Â£1.25. It's nothing special but pretty cool eating there. I've sussed all the stalls out by now. I sometimes pay the premium of Â£2 for avocado with fried rice and Inka Cola, a bright yellow Irn-Bru, but depends on my expenditure over the day.

It also has sent me to wander around the town, to different parts to explore. Each new neighbourhood is uncovered as I wander through similar to the Grand Theft Auto maps but so far with less car jacking and prostitutes. I stumbled upon a park that costs 20p to enter and inside are 3 concrete football pitches filled with Peruvians. I sat and watched for a while before trying to join in, the standard seemed to depend on the pitch but not that high overall. As the game ended and I went to join most people went off for lunch, leaving just a few of us to do some keepy ups. I actually tweaked my hip again going to chest the ball so I haven't returned, instead trying to stretch out my hip/leg in an attempt to get fit for playing at home.

I've also discovered a few little squares where I like to read in. I've gone through 3 books in the 2 weeks I've been here which has been so peaceful. I'm constantly popping into hostels to find new ones although most are trash or just Peru travel guides. I'm desperately searching for some Che Guevara literature that's not in Spanish.

My favourite square is Plaza Tupac Amaru, a square dedicated to the revolutionary who tried to overthrow the Spanish government, not the rapper.

Unfortunately many of the Inca ruins nearby cost a pretty penny so I haven't visited them but as of tomorrow I will begin my 4 day journey to Machu Picchu and will arrive on Thursday morning. Completing the first step on my Ancient Civilization tour home.

item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
I feel I've been able to express myself much better than before and can act myself more so than from before I left. Maybe you've noticed my journey throughout the blog, maybe you haven't. I hope I can continue this freedom of expression I've gained as I return.

I've had an incredible youth visiting many countries and living in a few of them for long periods of time. Many older people tell me in pubs to continue and do this whilst I can. I'm very lucky to have been given this opportunity thanks to all of my family, my parents and my grandparents and to live this life with little to no responsibility. I am aware this is rare and it's fair to say I have taken advantage of it. I have become pretty nostalgic since returning from MP knowing this is most likely the end and I know as I look back in the future I will look upon it all very fondly as I currently am. I really have got to do pretty much everything I wanted to do and cannot wait to now begin the next chapter.

Who really knows what the future will hold, what opportunities will present itself or where I'll be but at least for now my travelling days are over.

item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
I've been back a month or so now and as it get's colder the reality of being home is kicking in. Although that's not necessarily a bad thing.

I have no urge to go back out travelling at the moment and am content and ready for the next chapter in my life. After university I left with no idea what I wanted to do, so I went to enjoy myself, but I kept coming back with again no real idea, only what fun things to do next. Which has been brilliant but the time has come now where I have decided and am ready to take the necessary steps to start my life if you will in terms of a job.

I am constantly reminded of my time in Brazil and thew rest of South America as I always have done with my ventures to the U.S.A, France, Vietnam and the cities of Europe. Whether it be songs that I hear, people that I speak to, or maybe a taste,something somebody says or even a Portuguese cafe at the top of town where I can speak a little bit of Portuguese or have a piece of brigadeiro cake.

Each trip I took gave me new friends, new thoughts and new discoveries of myself. They have given me new ways to see the world and new lessons. Some of love, some of the nature of others, some of the nature of myself and the importance of both work and being idle. The need for routine alongside freedom from routine/time, as children at school, they can learn for so long before a break is needed and after doing lunchtime duty, it is necessary for the kids to run around for an hour free from teachers and work.

Its's all about the balance and finding my own place on the scale to ensure that I do not tip too far to one side, and respecting others have a differently place along the seesaw, and at different times aswell.

I think in honesty for too much of my life I have been too far balancced on the side of play and free time and thought. It can lead to strange feelings and dark places.

Interestingly enough ski trip was the happiest 4 months of my life, with 50hours of work a week matched with free time in the right time of day doing the thing I may love most in the world was perfect and everybody around had the same distribution of work as well as an attitude of nothing but pure enjoyment.

Parallel to these 4 months is the 4 months in Mountain View where I fell in love and lived with a woman who was amazing. That whole 4 months felt like a continuous happiness where nothing else mattered in the world, and only having 15 hours a week of work was plenty as I enjoyed all my spare time, even doing nothing.

Brazil comes just behind these two stretches of time but has a different feel to it and I feel was more important. In other situations, my path was laid out by companies who knew what they were selling, an unforgettable experience in exchange for your cheap labour and even though they had their issues, the lifestyle they were selling was well worth the cons.

It was however what pushed me to just up and leave, from previous stories of how it was for other and a yearning for freedom and belonging I left for Brazil wide eyed and ready to go wherever I chose, and have control over my own choices.

This was very important for me, I did things I never believed I could, I discovered how people do things because they have to, the importance of need as a motivator. Learning a language fell under this category. I learnt how to deal with things within myself, even if I didn't always go the best way about it.

I feel much more rounded and confident, in working, succeeding and in failing.

Since being back, it has taken some adjusting to old ways, or more assimilating my new self with old ways and relationships. There will be some growing pains but I think that is necessary. There were times back home before where I struggled and kept everything inside, for fear of not upsetting others if I'm honest. for not rocking the boat but over time, the unsaid things sat like a dead weight and became heavier and heavier until I submitted to the way it was or even broke down in an over emotional way.

The way I see it though is that this is ok, breaking down or letting things out, even though it is not the best way to go about change but it is a sign that something isn't right, you are not happy with the way things are going and you are letting yourself know, you cannot go on like this.

I wanted to be the real me, whether people liked it or not, and I have always found that easier away from home. Each time becoming more and more myself. I think it is because when you leave for a new place, there are no preconceptions of yourself from others, and in the past as my mistake I have acted in ways for others to like me, not how I always truly am.

I know we shouldn't care what people think but to a certain extent I do, we all do believe, it's human.

As I go away I don't care, I can act how I am and people can now choose whether they like me, I won't try to control how they think of me by changing or try changing how they feel by adapting my behaviour. I won't do it anymore.

I tried to let myself be me and in doing so I found myself accepting my failures, my human thoughts that are negative or horrible or just being wrong. I judged myself way less and could be even more honest. There's a quote that resonated with me from buzzfeed but really from Glennon Doyle's 'Love Warrior'

"If we choose to be perfect and admired, we must send our representatives out to live our lives; If we choose to be real and loved, we must send our true, tender selves.

That's the only way because to be loved, we have to be known, if we choose to introduce our true selves to anyone, we will get hurt, but we will be hurt either way. There is pain in hiding and pain outside of hiding.

The pain outside is better because nothing hurts as bad as not being known.

item.title: Black Coffee
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
So I went through with the interview like I said I shouldn't, after some good advice from wise old Pog, an employee at the company.

I got it.

Although I now have a mock lesson on Friday morning which is being drummed up as just as much of an interview, maybe even more. But my foot is in the door. I've bought the props, including a super hero dog, any name suggestions would be great.

Although in the demo video, there is an alternate version to the song "Baby Shark" about monkeys which I believe I will be hearing and dancing to EVERY day for 6 months. Not sure what I've got myself into.

But it's what I wanted and will allow me to continue to live here. Today I have been dancing around the flat and as a matter of fact, as I move around the town. I'm in a rhythm. Berty, I'm looking forward to throwback thursday tomorrow!

I've found myself enjoying lots of little things more and laughing to myself of past memories (Berty introducing himself as cheese to our Italian relatives) or things that I see occurring in the street. I've been watching lots of pigeons and their behaviours, weirdly,

I love it when they think they've got a big bit of bread and are well happy, only to run off and try and bite it, drop it before another pesky pigeon snatches it and thus continues the cycle. They are the same the world over.

But this whole day became a great day, from the wake up with motive, through the online training, with the help of the coffee, and onto the afternoon. I went flat hunting and if I wasn't so worried about disappointing people I would consider it as a hobby. You meet some absolute characters, visit their house as if on an episode of cribs and they treat you to coffee and the like. As I write this All Saints - Black Coffee plays, please listen to it, its amazing.

I began in the student area, what a guy, the front-runner, living with 3 brazilian dudes in a belter of a room in a pretty cool area close to both the center and the beaches. Just need to plug into his internet. He may appear later in the stories.

The second one I sought out as he was near a golf course I have my eye on. Little did I know it's also across from a favela. Not again. But I steered the course round and to the flat. Amazing living room with two incredibly friendly and attention seeking dogs. The best bit! I felt less like renting every time he removed them from the room. It had a router, an Xbox in the room (couldn't see any games) and a view of, yes, the favela. But in trying to show me the internet he fudged things up on it quite a bit and almost keeping me captive until he could fix it, despite his wife having sent me the speedtest already. Not to fear dude, was never gunna get it once I walked out the station.

The last one was just past a mall and Olympic building clearly built for tourists and Olympians alike. It smelt and felt of Downtown Disney, very clean, a stark contrast to the surroundings of the last house, which got me thinking a hell of a lot politically. But there is no time for that now, back to the guy. He was a weirdly lovely guy, albeit he would continue to tell me sad stories; of heart attacks, Spanish men beating his mum and how he is struggling to keep the apartment. He seemed to fear the outside world a fair bit. I almost wanted to rent it just for him but the room wasn't ideal and no visitors allowed, it just didn't seem the vibe I'm looking for. I'm sorry my dude, I hope you find your renter.

One more to see this weekend.

I returned back on a metro which had a different occurence in between each stop. Quite a ride. Buskers lightening the mood, beautiful girls standing for older ladies. A lady laughing with me in Portuguese as she followed me to the center of the cabin to make way for others and then realising I would have to bustle through for the next 2 stop. Queue the larger ladies entering at the next stop, but I made it off. It was a really pleasant trip despite the busy-ness. The commuters actually talked, not everyone, but there were many conversations up and down the cabin. It felt good to be around.

I hope this mindset continues. Just to get through this next bit and settle into the job and the apartment and I can release many of my thoughts about my own path and continue to enjoy whats going on around me instead.

item.title: I Feel Free
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
I did it.

I got the job,

Smashed the mock

It means the world to me. Literally,

I can, for the time being, live wherever I wish as long as the wifi is acceptable, the weather is good and the government lets me.

That is free,

I admittedly did the stupidest dance I've ever done down the hall, and I've danced pretty stupidly before.

But it feels good, I immediately felt thankful to everyone who's helped me, without my parents I wouldn't be so privileged to be in this position, they worked for this, not me. I did as always the bare minimum but with some energy. But I owe them an awful lot and I can only hope I repay them, or at least do the same for my kids. That goes for the rest of my family, my nans, my brother and his wife. They collectively have looked after me and brought me up, recently in particular.

Pog, who referred me, told me all I needed to know and relaxed me when I wasn't sure. As did many. Harry, who I tend to turn to when I know my worries are ridiculous, yet they still wash over me. Mainly cause I know he suffers the same worries. And anyone who has listened to me worry, or talk at them about myself or my ideas to clear my own head. Which is alot. Thank you.

I'm making it sound like I've won an Oscar but honestly it feels damn good and I just feel thankful.

My mind has also been flooding with plans and places to go. I've taken a step forward and it could go anywhere.

But for tomorrow Brazil and I will both celebrate our freedom. Saude!

item.title: The Importance of Being Idle
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
So I did not go out and celebrate Brazil independence as I had envisioned. Mainly cause I had nobody really to go out with. Most of my friends I had made are travellers or were away and the one resort had returned to the party hostel from where I once came, however I was not up for that, financially or emotionally.

This may sound sad but actually, I was not and I do not feel alone. Instead I got a bite to eat, met some Brazilian who is a B-list celeb in Portugal, weirdly, before watching the Brazil game alone in a bar. They cared as little as we do for friendlies.

So I returned to spend my evening with a chocolate bar, a beer and Captain America. I could not have been happier, this whole weekend has been spent training for the job, reading, coffees, beers and Netflix.

Now that the job is in place and the apartment is sorted for the next 3 months, I finally relaxed. I watched films and series and found myself engrossed in them (honestly almost crying at some terrible movies). I read books without wandering off the page, it would occasionally drift but only due to the thought provoking nature of the book and in the way it intended. My head was silent apart from the constant sound of songs in my head, which I fear will be harder to rid.

That is what I was looking for, back home I had way too many voices in my head and discussions going on. I couldn't relax. I needed to have some alone time and this weekend has done exactly that. I could have done this anywhere, ye, but that is also the point, I can do it anywhere so why not Rio, where I can also hit up the beach and the town when I feel like it for 6 months. I miss many people back home but am in frequent contact with lots of them and hopefully they understand that I needed to do this for me, to take a step forward and begin my life (I'm so gutted I cant explain it to Lola). I'll be back, probably.

I still have thoughts and discussions fill my head but those thoughts at the moment are the visa sitch, and whether I should leave for a month to Buenos Aires, so I can return and stay hopefully for carnival or just get the extension and leave a month before. If I leave it would stifle my settling here for almost 2 months but then, carnival. Before it was where should I live, by the beach or in the student area with 3 Brazilians.

But these are great problems, I compare it to being a football manager having 3 brilliant strikers, the Argentina problem. Do I play Messi, Higuain, Aguero or Tevez (once upon a time). Obviously I'd play Aguero and have Messi somewhere, but the point is, its a great problem and if my head can fully focus on that, everything seems easier. Decisions seem clearer (which is not my forte).

So I have chosen to live with the 3 Brazilians for the next two months, learn Portuguese and read more books and drink more coffee, from there we'll see how it goes, hopefully stay 3 more + carnaval and then hopefully on to another South American country, learn Spanish and explore another culture. I'm digging old civilizations atm, maybe Peru. I don't know, but the fact these are the thoughts echoing in my brain, is a good thing.

The slow life of hammocks and coffee shops suits me.

item.title: Desire Be Desire Go
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever seen Inception?

When the main characters infiltrate the dreams, they continue in the dreamworld unnoticed by the dreamers 'projections', until they perform an action which is abnormal and all of a sudden, the 'projections' all turn to face the foreigner inside the dream.

That is the scenario I find myself in fairly regularly here. I appear Brazilian and native to many, being brown and having only worn flip flops since arrival, finishing off my outfit with shorts, a vest showing my necklace and possibly an open shirt with a funky pattern if the weather requires. Muito Carioca

I genuinely fly under the radar, until I either do something that personifies me as a "gringo" or I open my mouth.

One instance of this was upon the metro. Rush hour, a busy station, I was very tired from walking all day, I began to board the equally busy train as an old lady stopped dead in front of me. I squeezed past to head into the carriage barely scraping her bag. She began to say a few things to me in Portuguese in a disapproving fashion. I was thinking, fuck off love, you just stopped and I barely touched your bag, but of course responded with my most used phrase "desculpe, eu nao falo portuguese". It was at this point, I came to notice a group of 3 girls turn to face me. I turned around and 6 or 7 more women were staring at me. An awful lot of people looking now and a surprising majority of women it seemed. It was at this point I realised I'd boarded the women only carriage and that this is what the old lady was of course telling me. I squeezed off in time but not in enough time to get back on elsewhere.

Moments like these and moments where I cannot understand a word they say make me feel like a gringo and it frustrates me so. I have begun private Portuguese lessons, 3 hours a day, 3 days a week and its already helping. Yesterday I understood so much of what the guy was saying and was surprising myself at what I could say. It takes a helluva lot of focus to listen to every word they say. A few seconds of distraction and you've lost the scent, you once more have to regain focus before you can understand what they're saying. I understand more than I can say and they talk more than I, but it's a nice change for me to do the listening for a change.

Within those 3 hours I find myself pretty absorbed in the lesson and have less and less thoughts distracting me, I feel locked in, I love it. A feeling I only felt during competitive sports or teaching, which is now starting to emanate into more aspects of my life.

My teaching job has begun and although locked in for the 25 minute lessons, It's not quite the dream job I had once portrayed. I can only work for 15 hours Mon- Fri atm and there's a chance the 25 minute slots don't get booked or they just don't show up. On both of these occurrences I receive no money, so I need to start working weekends, get a side hustle or just live super frugal. I will though and this is exactly what I wanted, to make it work, overcome such obstacles. It was almost too easy it seemed, and it was, but I'm not worried and am loving the problem solving mindset that it's brought on.

In the meantime I'm adopting the Carioca lifestyle, and keeping it slow; yesterday working in the morning before slowly getting ready, eating, and making my way to a cafe for a coffee and to read my book. I then hit the beach , upgraded to a beer and finished reading.

The book is called "The Island of Dr. Moreau". Cracking little read, would recommend. Although, the Simpsons annoyingly did their own interpretation in Treehouse of Horror and also I couldn't help but envision one of the characters as Mad Eye Moody. But apart from these media planted blips in my imagination, it was great and gets the mind thinking of the beast within. The animal mindset in us.

The last 3 books have weirdly all had this notion behind them. Its got me thinking a lot about the drives and noticing my own actions. Those driven by the animal and those by the human. The id and the ego. The feeling and the thought. Or as homo deus calls it, the experiencing self and the narrating self.

I find my narrating self or my thought, when its in control, doing great things or making movements such as deciding to go to Brazil, making plans in advance, getting lessons, doing good things and generally throwing myself in the deep end making my experiencing self deal with it.

Which is probably a good thing because my experiencing self would like to curl up and read buzzfeed and watch netflix all day with occasionally comforting social interaction. I do find myself at times being nervous, when it comes to actually doing things but I make myself do them anyway and I'm always glad I did because I always enjoy it once I've done it, like jumping into a cold river. Kinda like having a devil and an angel on my shoulder arguing about decisions in the present moment.

I read something inspiring about this recently, how we should remember that its not the devil or the angel in control but actually the person in the middle and we have the power to choose who to listen to.

And sometimes its also better to listen to the devil.

Shoutout to Shaun Livingston on the cameo.

My next book to read is "thinking fast and slow" of which appears to go in more depth about these states of mind. I'm really getting into my psych stuff and my own psyche but as I maintain with many of my previous classmates, people studied psychology at uni to understand themselves just as much as the people around them. So prepare for more on this.

My narrating self has given my experiencing self 3 situations over this weekend alone to do shit he probably doesn't wanna do as it draws near, but he will, have fun dude.

item.title: Where is the Love
item.dc:creator: marcociuffini
item.content:encoded:
This is still one long transition, still planting seeds and establishing roots, last Sunday moving to a flat where I'll reside for the next two months, possibly 5.

Yes, there's a hammock!

You may remember I discussed the house hunting process a few weeks back...

"I began in the student area, what a guy, the front-runner, living with 3 brazilian dudes in a belter of a room in a pretty cool area close to both the center and the beaches. Just need to plug into his internet. He may appear later in the stories."

Well, he does. His name is Jose and the landlord of this flat, and here, there's a difference, its nicer and therefore more expensive but more importantly, the guys hang out together and we have now most nights. As soon as I arrived all 3 came out to greet me and we headed into the back patio where we spoke for a long time. Of Brazil, of England, similarities, differences and politics. This then led to a long political debate between the Brazilians in of course, Portuguese. I insisted they continued in this way.

They have an Presidential election coming up very soon and its becoming an increasingly interesting one, which has led to a lot of debate and involvement.

I couldn't understand all their discussion, as we all know, when politics is the agenda, the passion and speed increases, but I got the gist. I could tell what each person stood for, who disagreed with whom and where they stood on the political spectrum. One left, one center and another leftish center, but as it seems that's not so clear this time around.

I really am understanding more and am becoming more and more comfortable using it. I had my last lesson today, because moneys a thing, and came out ready to start living amongst the Cariocas. Ironically though when I received my certificate and the teachers showered me with praise, I tried to ask where my cake was and failed miserably, asking "where the ball?". Also earlier I had the teacher laughing because my two most common phrases equate to "I don't know" and "not much". Solid Base.

Despite my pitfalls, when we were all hanging out watching the debate the other day, with the subtitles on, I could understand way more than I imagined, again knowing each persons position and main issues. The only killer was the speed of the speaking. If I could deconstruct time and slow it down, life would be easy, but it's at least getting easier.

They had some similar characters, A loud mouthed right winged guy with 1% of votes who shouted his points. A lefty with no tie, who seemed pretty chill (I liked him because he spoke clear and slow, and yknow... left), and an older very rigid man who wants everyone to have cards which can be swiped with all their medical history on. I think.

Now, one guy wasn't there. The front-runner. Scared you may think?

Well, no, but Brazil should be, he was recently hospitalized because he was stabbed by a guy with mental issues who disagreed with his views. I can see why. Imagine Trump but with a military background. His name is Bolsonaro and he's divided the country, riding high on the crest of the right wing wave engulfing the world.

Seriously, look up some of things hes said, they are terrible, beyond imaginable for a presidential candidate. Such highlights include

"She doesn't deserve to be raped because she's very ugly. She's not my type, I'd never rape her. I'm not a rapist, but if I was, I wouldn't rape her because she doesn't deserve it."


âBolsonaro speaking to Zero Hora in December 2014, explaining why he previously told leftist deputy, Maria do Rosario: "I wouldn't rape you, you don't deserve it."

 

"I wouldn't be able to love a gay son. I wouldn't be a hypocrite, I'd prefer a son to die in an accident than appear with a moustacho."


âInterview with Playboy magazine, June 2011

As you can imagine, this has sparked furor, debate and many protests

But he will return for the second debate healthy and unfortunately bolstered by this attempt on his life. His military background is an issue and his Trump-esque claims that he wont accept a loss make him scary win or lose.

Now they have a first round of voting on Sunday of which they may choose from a variety of candidates, but similar to America, only the top 2 advance to the second round of which you may only choose one.

Hopefully all those against Bolsonaro will combine, although he already has a worryingly high 40% of votes, considering this probably doesn't include the silent voters who will hide their preference because they know its socially unacceptable to support him. I know one person who told me his vote was a secret... so its not really.

The real problem is, that the second most popular is the left candidate, A man advocated by the once great Lula who I am told once did even greater things for the poor people of Brazil. However he currently resides in jail due to his involvement in a huge corruption scandal, involving the oil companies (shock) and other members of their government. This has really rocked Brazil, with people telling me how let down they feel by Lula, how they will not vote for his 'puppet' and the status quo, which they wish to change.

Lefties and centrists alike considering going extreme right for a change, ignoring certain aspects of Bolsonaro's views, of which to me are inexcusable, all in the hope of something different.

To me it feels like talking to a friend who runs into the arms of a relationship that is only bad news. They know what this persons about and how they treat people, but they don't care. From the outside, it seems crazy, how can they do this? How can they ignore these views? But on the inside it's different. They don't want to go back to how it was. They were hurt. Big time.

Why did you do this to them Lula.

I gave my views, discussed Trump, they told me they would never have voted for him if they were American and they can see the comparisons, but it seems things are different on the inside. They are flirting with the idea of a no vote, of which I expressed my regret of not sorting myself to vote in Brexit. They listened and it seems they all have a lot to consider, to them picking the lesser of two evils. Although possibly the more.

The central candidates are supposedly considering dropping out to combine for one popular candidate to help him or her advance and take on Bolsonaro. Will it be enough, who knows, but it's definitely in the balance and an incredibly intriguing election.

Why am I always in the country for the election of tyrants.
